com.github.fge.lambdas.comparators

Interface ThrowingComparator<T>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - the type argument of the comparator
    All Superinterfaces:
    Comparator<T>, ThrowingFunctionalInterface<ThrowingComparator<T>,Comparator<T>>
    Functional Interface:
    This is a functional interface and can therefore be used as the assignment target for a lambda expression or method reference.

    @FunctionalInterface
public interface ThrowingComparator<T>
extends Comparator<T>, ThrowingFunctionalInterface<ThrowingComparator<T>,Comparator<T>>
    A throwing Comparator

      • orTryWith

        default ThrowingComparator<T> orTryWith(ThrowingComparator<T> other)
        Description copied from interface: ThrowingFunctionalInterface
        Chain this throwing lambda with another throwing lambda if this one fails

        This means that if this lambda fails with an unchecked exception, the second one will be tried instead.

        Since this method itself returns a throwing lambda, it means you can chain more than two lambdas this way: l1.orTryWith(l2).orTryWith(l3) etc.

        Specified by:
        orTryWith in interface ThrowingFunctionalInterface<ThrowingComparator<T>,Comparator<T>>
        Parameters:
        other - the other throwing lambda
        Returns:
        a new throwing lambda

      • fallbackTo

        default Comparator<T> fallbackTo(Comparator<T> fallback)
        Description copied from interface: ThrowingFunctionalInterface
        Chain this throwing lambda with a non throwing lambda fallback

        If this throwing lambda fails with a checked exception, the fallback (which cannot throw checked exceptions) is invoked instead.

        As this method returns a non throwing version, you cannot chain any behavior afterwards.

        Specified by:
        fallbackTo in interface ThrowingFunctionalInterface<ThrowingComparator<T>,Comparator<T>>
        Parameters:
        fallback - the fallback
        Returns:
        a non throwing lambda

      • orThrow

        default <E extends RuntimeException> Comparator<T> orThrow(Class<E> exceptionClass)
        Description copied from interface: ThrowingFunctionalInterface
        Change the unchecked exception thrown by this throwing lambda

        This allows to change the exception which is thrown if this throwing lambda throws a checked exception; as for the default behavior, the exception thrown by the lambda is set as the cause of an instance of this exception class.

        See ThrowablesFactory for more details.

        As this method returns a non throwing version, you cannot chain any behavior afterwards.

        Specified by:
        orThrow in interface ThrowingFunctionalInterface<ThrowingComparator<T>,Comparator<T>>
        Type Parameters:
        E - the type of this exception class
        Parameters:
        exceptionClass - the exception class
        Returns:
        a non throwing lambda

      • orReturn

        default Comparator<T> orReturn(int defaultValue)
